page.title: 08Education 150 Years Droxford
page.content: {1Droxford}National School founded 1835 Occupied premises on Glebe land whose poor facilities fell into disrepair so that it was struck from Board of Educ. list,moved to new council premises in 1929.The school celebrated its{150th} Anniversary with a book " Droxford School 1835_1985" and with festivities on 21st of June.It rained heavily,but many ex_pupils including some from old school, friends,parents,governors and County Educ. Officer came.Truncated indoor programme included a pageant, gymnastics,maypole dancing,singing,tea and cake for guests,sit down tea for pupils.On sunny 15th July,performances were repeated outside.A time capsule containing children's artefacts was buried,its location is to be revealed by Hants Record Office in 2035 Present pupils plan reunion in church at noon on 19th July 2035
